remarks: The set of all hyperplanes of a left module or left vector space equals the set of all kernels of nonzero functionals.  (Contributed by NM, 17-Jul-2014.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
lshpset2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lshpset2.d $e |- D = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
lshpset2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` D ) $.
lshpset2.h $e |- H = ( LSHyp ` W ) $.
lshpset2.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` W ) $.
lshpset2.k $e |- K = ( LKer ` W ) $.
lshpset2N $p |- ( W e. LVec -> H = { s | E. g e. F ( g =/= ( V X. { .0. } ) /\ s = ( K ` g ) ) } ) $.
$d F g $.
$d H g s $.
$d K g $.
$d V g $.
$d W g s $.
